'a European' is correct. It's not starting with a vowel, the word needs to start with a vowel SOUND, which 'European' does not
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 165975582 ----- You use the word "an" whenever the following noun starts with a vowel. It's also easier to speak the phrase "an european" aloud vs. "a european".
